post: We know how important yet challenging teaching elections can be. That's why we're inviting you to attend a free webinar, Shaping the Nation: Exploring Voting Processes and Rights, Elections, and Civic Responsibilities hosted by BRI and GBH Education this Thursday at 7:00PM EST. During the webinar, you'll explore interactive digital resources and learn engaging ways to teach local, state, and federal elections in the classroom, grades 6-12. For those who attend the live stream and complete a brief survey, a certificate will be available. Join BRI staff Joe Schmidt and Rachel Humphries for an exciting discussion! For more information and how to register, visit  https://lnkd.in/gb6siB3r

Georgia educators, don't wait! Register to attend the Georgia Council for the Social Studies in Athens October 24-25th. Come meet BRI staff Christopher Janson and Lori Rech! GCSS will be celebrating 60 Years of excellence in Georgia Social Studies advocacy and outreach. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eTQMxbwb to register.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #GCSS2024

#OTD October 14, 1774, the Declaration and Resolves of the First Continental Congress was adopted. The statement outlined the colonists' grievances against the British Parliament's Intolerable Acts. Within their grievances, the colonists outlined rights that would evolve into the Bill of Rights. The colonists debated on how to confront the parliamentary acts placed on them by Britain. Including a plan of action, with acts such as boycotting British trade, sending a petition to the King, and publishing addresses, the Declaration and Resolves came to fruition.  https://lnkd.in/eKZiS9kH

Today marks the 250th anniversary of the Declaration and Resolves of the First Continental Congress. The statement outlined the colonists' grievances against the British Parliament's Intolerable Acts. Join the Bill of Rights Institute in commemorating the anniversaries leading up to America's 250th birthday by joining our A250 newsletter:  https://lnkd.in/evyYkrw4  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #America250  #A250

Teaching Indigenous Peoples' Day? To view a list of resources curated by BRI staff of our favorite materials related to Indigenous Peoples' Day, explore  https://lnkd.in/edbrvs2Z  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #IndigenousPeoplesDay

Calling all Arizona civics and history teachers! We know how challenging and rewarding teaching can be. Join us for a professional development event on October 26th at Arizona State University's Center for American Civics and become a student again! Come be a student again from 9:30-3:00pm and dive into Government and Primary Source materials, with BRI Senior Program Director Joe Schmidt. To learn more and register, visit  https://lnkd.in/eWkhk9Bw See you there!  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #Arizonateacher  #ProfessionalDevelopment

BRI has established the Gary Colletti Scholarship for NCSS Attendees. Gary Colletti was a devoted educator who left a lasting legacy among the many teachers and students he helped support. The Bill of Rights Institute is ensuring Collettis legacy continues through the establishment of the Gary Colletti Conference Scholarship, and will offer the first cohort of awards for the 2024 National Council for the Social Studies Annual Conference. Colletti, a former classroom teacher in New York and Virginia, served as BRIs Director of Teacher and Student Programs before passing away in 2021. He was beloved by students and educators, and meeting fellow teachers at the annual NCSS conference was always one of the highlights of his year. Read more about the Gary Colletti Scholarship at  https://lnkd.in/ecXQWCKc  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI

Planning your fall trips or holiday travel? Great news! The Bill of Rights Institute has partnered with TravelingToGive, a smart trip planning tool that gives back to nonprofits. By using our travel booking tool, you can make a direct impact on civic education. Visit  https://lnkd.in/epqqzbzz to book.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #travel

School debate should be free, fair, and honest, where all students and viewpoints are welcome. Incubate Debate's first competitive tournament of the season, Incubate. Fall, is now open for registration. Acquired earlier last month by the Bill of Rights Institute, Incubate is a rapidly-expanding school debate program. The partnership will give millions of new students access to school debate, while removing the polarizing partisanship affecting many school debate competitions today. Know a student who'd like to compete? Have them visit  https://lnkd.in/eDs_JsUn  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #studentdebate

Join Dr. Jane Kamensky, President of Monticello, as she reflects on her journey from academia to leading one of Americas most historic landmarks. In this compelling interview, Dr. Kamensky dives into Thomas Jeffersons complex and paradoxical legacy, his relationship with John Adams, and Monticellos pivotal role in promoting civil discourse. Discover how Monticello uses historical education and innovative visitor experiences to foster a deeper understanding of Jefferson's life and the American experiment. Watch Dr. Kamensky's interview here,  https://lnkd.in/eRCU5GjR  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CDL2024
